Package Abstraction

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
Abstraction.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Object
Represents a pawn in a game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Pawn(Board board, Position pos, Case player)
    Creates a new pawn with the specified position and associated player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(Board board, Position pos, Case player)
      Creates a new pawn with the specified position and associated player.
      Parameters:
      board - The board where the pawn is placed.
      pos - The current position of the pawn.
      player - The player associated with the pawn.

      Returns the current position of the pawn.

    • setPossibleDestination

      public void setPossibleDestination(Set<Position> possibleDestination)
      Sets the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      Parameters:
      possibleDestination - A set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.

    • topMove

      public void topMove(Board board, Set<Position> possibleDestination, Position pos, Boolean canSpecialMove)
      Moves the pawn towards the top, if possible. Checks the potential wall and the next case in the board. Adds the new position to possible destinations if it is empty or triggers a special move.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board
      possibleDestination - The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      pos - The current position of the pawn
      canSpecialMove - Indicates if it can do a special move or not

    • rightMove

      public void rightMove(Board board, Set<Position> possibleDestination, Position pos, Boolean canSpecialMove)
      Moves the pawn towards the right, if possible. Checks the potential wall and the next case in the board. Adds the new position to possible destinations if it is empty or triggers a special move.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board
      possibleDestination - The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      pos - The current position of the pawn
      canSpecialMove - Indicates if it can do a special move or not

    • botMove

      public void botMove(Board board, Set<Position> possibleDestination, Position pos, Boolean canSpecialMove)
      Moves the pawn towards the bottom, if possible. Checks the potential wall and the next case in the board. Adds the new position to possible destinations if it is empty or triggers a special move.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board
      possibleDestination - The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      pos - The current position of the pawn
      canSpecialMove - Indicates if it can do a special move or not

    • leftMove

      public void leftMove(Board board, Set<Position> possibleDestination, Position pos, Boolean canSpecialMove)
      Moves the pawn towards the left, if possible. Checks the potential wall and the next case in the board. Adds the new position to possible destinations if it is empty or triggers a special move.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board
      possibleDestination - The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      pos - The current position of the pawn
      canSpecialMove - Indicates if it can do a special move or not

    • specialMove

      public void specialMove(Board board, Set<Position> possibleDestination, Position pos, Movement m)
      Performs a special move depending on the specified movement direction. Checks the potential wall and triggers appropriate move or other moves.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board
      possibleDestination - The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      pos - The current position of the pawn
      m - The specified movement direction

    • possibleMove

      public Set<Position> possibleMove(Board board, Position pos)
      Calculates the possible moves for this pawn given a specific board and position.
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the game board.
      pos - The position from which to calculate possible moves.
      Returns:
      The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.

    • finishLine

      public void finishLine()
      Determines the finish line for this pawn based on the associated player.

    • isWinner

      public Boolean isWinner()
      Determines if this pawn is a winner based on its current position.
      Returns:
      true if the pawn's current position is part of the finish line, false otherwise.
